00004 // Notes:

00006 //   that defines an int as at least 32 bits wide
00007 //   (if compiled on a platform where int is smaller,
00008 //   the possible sizes of some file sections is restricted)
00009 
00010 // * the backups should be moved to another directory to avoid transfer
00011 // * dil2al can warn about violations of the hints about efficient working

00087                 Time(int h, int m, int s) { t = (((((time_t) h)*60)+((time_t) m))*60)+((time_t) s); }

00095 class StringList {
00096 protected:
00097   StringList * Next;
00098   String s;
00099 public:
00100   ~StringList() { if (Next) delete Next; }
00101   StringList() { Next=NULL; }
00102   StringList(unsigned long n) { if (n) Next = new StringList(n-1); else Next = NULL; }
00103   StringList(const String cs, StringList * cn = NULL) { s=cs; Next=cn; }
00104   StringList(String cs, const char sep);
00105   String & operator[](unsigned long n); // (utilties.cc)
00106   StringList * get_Next() { return Next; }
00107   StringList * List_Index(long n); // (utilities.cc)
00108   // append to n (without breaking link to n+1)
00109   void append(unsigned long n, String & ins); // (utilties.cc)
00110   // insert at n (n becomes n+1)
00111   void insert(unsigned long n, String & ins); // (utilties.cc)
00112   // count number of items following this one
00113   unsigned long length() { if (Next) return 1+Next->length(); else return 1; }
00114   // find in list
00115   long iselement(String el, unsigned long n = 0); // (utilities.cc)
00116   // find substring in list
00117   long contains(String substr, unsigned long n = 0); // (utilities.cc)
00118   // find firsrt in list that is substring of source string
00119   long first_contained_in(String & sourcestr, unsigned long n = 0); // (utilities.cc)
00120   // split a string into list elements
00121   unsigned long split(unsigned long n, String cs, const char sep = '\n');
00122   // concatenate list
00123   String concatenate(String sepstr = ""); // (utilities.cc)
00124 };

00158 // The recursive version of the Quick_String_Hash::read() function can be slightly
00159 // faster (may be machine, compiler and compilation dependent, e.g. a compiler may
00160 // optimize one of the functions better), but will consume a bit more stack space
00161 // during operation as a recursion is made for each character in a string.
00162 #define RECURSIVE_QUICK_STRING_HASH
00163 // CONST_QUICK_STRING_HASH_ENCODE can achieve a memory savings of maximally 1 node per
00164 // hashed string. Often, less is saved, since some strings may be subsets of other
00165 // strings.
00166 // Beware: For some odd reason, using this compile-time option can cause segmentation
00167 // faults when inserting to a dynamically allocated Quick_String_Hash object, e.g.
00168 // Quick_String_Hash * qsh = new Quick_String_Hash(); qsh->insert(sl[i].chars());
00169 // #define CONST_QUICK_STRING_HASH_ENDNODE
00170 // *** There is an even more memory efficient implementation where a conversion
00171 //     table is maintained. Only letters that occur receive a conversion value
00172 //     below 255. There are then fewer and shorter empty spans in allocated lists.
00173 // #define CONVERSION_TABLE_QUICK_STRING_HASH
00174 
00175 class Quick_String_Hash {
00176         // The quick allocate version of this class immediately allocates all 256 elements and
00177         // sets the offset to 0.
00178         // Note that this does not use an actual hash algorithm. It is instead a tree generator,
00179         // intended only to allocate and test the allocation of hash key strings.
00180         protected:
00181                 Quick_String_Hash ** list; // pointer offset from allocated list
00182                 int offset; // 1 means list starts at 1 instead of 0
00183                 int len; // 0 = none allocated
00184                 Quick_String_Hash * add_list_element(int i);
00185         public:
00186                 // constructor
00187                 Quick_String_Hash(): list(NULL), offset(0), len(0) {}
00188                 // destructor
00189                 ~Quick_String_Hash() { if (list) { for (int i=0; i<len; i++) delete list[i]; delete[] list; } }
00190                 // functions
00191                 Quick_String_Hash & insert(const char * s);
00192                 Quick_String_Hash & operator<<(const char * s) { return insert(s); }
00193                 int read(const char * s) const;
00194                 int operator[](const char * s) const { return read(s); }
00195                 unsigned long nodes() const;
00196                 unsigned long size() const;
00197 };
00198 #ifdef CONST_QUICK_STRING_HASH_ENDNODE
00199 extern const Quick_String_Hash _qsh_endnode;
00200 #endif

00224 /*
00225         <A NAME="NOVELTY-marker">
00226         NOVELTY marker and content range tags:
00227         </A>
00228 
00229                 Marker begin
00230                         <A NAME="NOVELTY-some-id">[<B>N</B>]</A>
00231                 when the item has been included in a paper draft this becomes
00232                         <A NAME="NOVELTY-some-id" HREF="nearest-anchor-in-paper">[<B>N</B>]</A>
00233 
00234                 Marker end
00235                         <!-- @NOVELTY-some-id@ -->
00236                 when all qualifying and quantifying information is known this becomes
00237                         <!-- @NOVELTY-some-id@ @CONTEXT: cid1,...,cidn@ @IMP: X1.x1,...,Xn.xn [0,inf]@ @LEN: X.x [0,inf]@ @SECTION: sec1,...,secm@ -->
00238 
00239                 Dereferenced marker begin
00240                         <A NAME="NOVELTYREF-some-id" HREF="document-containing-NOVELTY-tags">
00241 
00242                 Dereferenced marker end
00243                         </A><!-- @NOVELTYREF-some-id@  -->
00244 
00245                 Content range begin
00246                         <!-- @Begin NOVELTY-some-id@ -->
00247 
00248                 Content range end
00249                         <!-- @End NOVELTY-some-id@ -->
00250 
00251         (extracted) NOVELTY item in Topical Context Hierarchy:
00252                 e.g.
00253                 (Context: JLI model definition, Importance: 2.0, Length: 0.5, Section: INT)
00254                          
00255 */
00256

00333 class Topical_DIL_Files_Root {
00334 // used to anchor the first element that is created by default
00335 // and to access all elements in the list
00336 // Note: the first element is created by default (while lists normally
00337 // begin empty), since Refresh() is called in it.
00338 // *** an alternative is to move the actual implementation of most
00339 //     member functions to this Root object and to use a static
00340 //     member function to refresh and create the list
00341         public:
00342                 // constructor
00343                 Topical_DIL_Files_Root() { Topical_DIL_Files * tdf = new Topical_DIL_Files(); dil.link_before(tdf); }
00344                 // parameters
00345                 PLLRoot<Topical_DIL_Files> dil;
00346                 // functions
00347                 inline String * operator[](int n) { if (dil.head()) return (*dil.head())[n]; return NULL; }
00348                 inline String * File(int n = 0) { if (dil.head()) return dil.head()->File(n); return NULL; }
00349                 inline String * Title(int n = 0) { if (dil.head()) return dil.head()->Title(n); return NULL; }
00350                 inline filetitle_t * Topic(int n = 0) { if (dil.head()) return dil.head()->Topic(n); return NULL; }
00351                 void Invalidate() { if (dil.head()) dil.head()->Invalidate(); }
00352                 int Refresh() { if (dil.head()) return dil.head()->Refresh(); return 0; }
00353 };
00354 
00355 inline String * Topical_DIL_Files::operator[](int n) {
00356         Protected_Linked_List_Indexed_Access(Topical_DIL_Files,File(),File());
00357 }
00358 
00359 inline void Topical_DIL_Files::Invalidate() {
00360         updated=false;
00361         if (Prev()) Prev()->Invalidate();
00362         if (Next()) Next()->Invalidate();
00363 }
00364 
00365 // Refreshes from the head if accessed components needed to be updated
00366 #define Topical_DIL_Files_Updated_Access(Here,There,ThereSteps) \
00367         if (updated) { \
00368                 Protected_Linked_List_Indexed_Access(Topical_DIL_Files,Here,There); \
00369         } \
00370         if (!Prev()) { \
00371                 if (Refresh()) return ThereSteps(n); \
00372                 else return NULL; \
00373         } else { \
00374                 Invalidate(); \
00375                 return Prev()->ThereSteps(n+1); \
00376         }
00377

00379 inline String * Topical_DIL_Files::File(int n = 0) {
00380         Topical_DIL_Files_Updated_Access(&(ft.file),File(),File)
00381 }
00382

00384         Topical_DIL_Files_Updated_Access(&(ft.title),Title(),Title)
00385 }

00387 inline filetitle_t * Topical_DIL_Files::Topic(int n = 0) {
00388         Topical_DIL_Files_Updated_Access(&ft,Topic(),Topic)
00389 }

00398 // DIL ID storage, operators and conversion
00399 class DIL_ID {
00400 protected:
00401   void init(String & idstr) {
00402     String idmajorstr(idstr.before('.'));
00403     idmajor[0] = (idnumber) atol((const char *) String(idmajorstr.at(0,idmajorstr.length()-6)));
00404     idmajor[1] = (idnumber) atol((const char *) String(idmajorstr.from(((int) idmajorstr.length())-6)));
00405     idminor = (unsigned int) atoi((const char *) String(idstr.after('.')));
00406   }
00407   //            mutable String idstr; (see utilities.cc)
00408 public:
00409   // constructors
00410   DIL_ID(): idminor(0) { idmajor[0]=0; idmajor[1]=0; }
00411   DIL_ID(idnumber idmaj0, idnumber idmaj1, unsigned int idmin): idminor(idmin) { idmajor[0]=idmaj0; idmajor[1]=idmaj1; }
00412   DIL_ID(DIL_ID & id): idminor(id.idminor) { idmajor[0]=id.idmajor[0]; idmajor[1]=id.idmajor[1]; }
00413   DIL_ID(String & idstr) { init(idstr); }
00414   DIL_ID(const SubString & idstr) { String s(idstr); init(s); }
00415   // parameters
00416   // major ID numbers are usually composed of a concatenation
00417   // of year, month, day, hour, minute, second
00418   // minor ID numbers distinguish DIL entries with
00419   // identical major ID numbers
00420   idnumber idmajor[2]; // major ID number (assumed 14+ digits)
00421   unsigned int idminor; // minor ID number
00422   // DIL_ID,DIL_ID operators
00423   DIL_ID & operator=(const DIL_ID & id) { idmajor[0]=id.idmajor[0]; idmajor[1]=id.idmajor[1]; idminor=id.idminor; return *this; }
00424   bool operator==(const DIL_ID & id2) const { return ((idmajor[0]==id2.idmajor[0]) && (idmajor[1]==id2.idmajor[1]) && (idminor==id2.idminor)); }
00425   bool operator!=(const DIL_ID & id2) const { return (!(*this==id2)); }
00426   bool operator<(const DIL_ID & id2) const { return ((idmajor[0]<id2.idmajor[0]) || ((idmajor[0]==id2.idmajor[0]) && (idmajor[1]<id2.idmajor[1])) || ((idmajor[0]==id2.idmajor[0]) && (idmajor[1]==id2.idmajor[1]) && (idminor<id2.idminor))); }
00427   bool operator<=(const DIL_ID & id2) const { return ((*this<id2) || (*this==id2)); }
00428   bool operator>(const DIL_ID & id2) const { return (id2<*this); }
00429   bool operator>=(const DIL_ID & id2) const { return (id2<=*this); }
00430   // DIL_ID,String operators
00431   DIL_ID & operator=(String & idstr) { init(idstr); }
00432   DIL_ID & operator=(String * idstr) { init(*idstr); }
00433   String str() const;
00434   // Beware that the returned pointer is only valid
00435   // until the next call to this function and as long
00436   // as the corresponding DIL_ID object exists. If
00437   // it is not desirable that pointers are invalidated
00438   // by calls to this function from other DIL_ID objects
00439   // then idstr must be included as a mutable variable
00440   // of each DIL_ID object.
00441   // Note that the static variable (or object variable)
00442   // is used so that the returned pointer points to an
00443   // existing character string.
00444   inline const char* chars() const { 
00445     /*cout << "CHECKING: ";
00446       for (char * tp = (char *) str().chars(); *tp!='\0'; tp++) cout << (*tp) << '[' << (int) (*tp) << ']';
00447       cout << '\n';*/
00448     /*String idstr(str());
00449       cout << "idstr in chars() function: ";
00450       int i = 0;
00451       for (char * tp = (char *) idstr.chars(); (*tp!='\0') && (i<80); tp++, i++) cout << (*tp) << '{' << (int) (*tp) << '}';
00452       cout << '\n';*/
00453     static String idstr; // need static here to avoid trouble with life-time of object that chars() return points to
00454     idstr = str();
00455     return idstr.chars(); }
00456   operator const char*() const { return chars(); }
00457   // functions
00458   bool valid() { return ((idmajor[0]!=0) && (idmajor[1]!=0) && (idminor!=0)); }
00459   bool Write_DIL_ID_to_Binary_Cache(ofstream & cfl); // (see utilities.cc)
00460   bool Read_DIL_ID_from_Binary_Cache(ifstream & cfl); // (see utilities.cc)
00461 };

00478 // DIL entry content
00479 class DIL_entry_content {
00480 #define PLAN_ENTRY_TYPE_UNASSIGNED -1
00481 #define PLAN_ENTRY_TYPE_NONE 0
00482 #define PLAN_ENTRY_TYPE_ACTION 1
00483 #define PLAN_ENTRY_TYPE_GOAL 2
00484 #define PLAN_ENTRY_TYPE_OBJECTIVE 3
00485 #define PLAN_ENTRY_TYPE_OUTCOME 4
00486 #define PLAN_ENTRY_TYPE_VARIABLE 5
00487 #define PLAN_OUTCOME_DESIRABILITY valuation
00488 #define COMPLETION_STATE_OBSOLETE -1.0
00489 #define COMPLETION_STATE_REPLACED -2.0
00490 #define COMPLETION_STATE_DONE_DIFFERENTLY -3.0
00491 #define COMPLETION_STATE_NO_LONGER_POSSIBLE -4.0
00492 protected:
00493   DIL_entry * entry;
00494   int planentrytype;
00495   Plan_entry_content * plancontent;
00496 public:
00497   // destructor
00498   ~DIL_entry_content() { delete text; delete plancontent; }
00499   // constructors
00500   DIL_entry_content(DIL_entry & e);
00501   // parameters
00502   // Note that the current target resolution for
00503   // time specifications is minutes.
00504   time_t started; // time started on detail item tasks
00505   // note: can remove this, since the head
00506   // link to a TL entry indicates this
00507   time_t required; // time required for detail item tasks
00508   float completion; // completion ratio (also see special values defined above)
00509   float valuation; // value (compared to 1.0)
00510   String * text; // detail item content
00511   // *** could add links to Task Log entry IDs here
00512   int Is_Plan_Entry(); // (see utilities.cc)
00513   Plan_entry_content * Get_Plan_Entry_Content() { return plancontent; }
00514   bool Write_Topical_to_Binary_Cache(ofstream & cfl, bool gottext);
00515   bool Read_Topical_from_Binary_Cache(ifstream & cfl, bool gottext);
00516   bool Binary_Cache_Diagnostic(DIL_entry_content * cached, int & testedbytes);
00517 };
00518 
00519 // Topical DIL in which DIL entry appears
00520 class DIL_Topical_List: public PLLHandle<DIL_Topical_List> {
00521 #define DILTOPICS_REL_UNSPECIFIED       0.0
00522 protected:
00523   DIL_entry * entry;
00524 public:
00525   // constructors
00526   DIL_Topical_List(DIL_entry & e); // (see utilities.cc)
00527   DIL_Topical_List(DIL_entry & e, String tfile, String ttitle, float trelevance); // (see utilities.cc)
00528   // destructor (see http://www.geocrawler.com/archives/3/361/1998/1/0/2004286/)
00529   ~DIL_Topical_List() {} 
00530   // parameters

00538 // Project AL in which DIL entry appears
00539 // <A NAME="DIL_AL_List"></A>
00540 // *** As the dependency hierarchy is implemented, this will
00541 //     provide a linked list to superior DIL entries
00542 //     Note (20010422): The parameter "superior" below provides
00543 //     some of these facilities now, and is used as a cache for
00544 //     Superiorbyid(), but perhaps a further enhancement can still
00545 //     be made to offer additional benefits.
00546 class DIL_AL_List: public PLLHandle<DIL_AL_List> {
00547 #define DIL_Superiors DIL_AL_List
00548   // A value of 0.0 for unspecified relevance is a reasonable
00549   // choice, as there is no purpose in specifying a connection
00550   // to a superior to which the dependency is of no relevance.
00551 #define DILSUPS_REL_UNSPECIFIED 0.0
00552 #define DILSUPS_UNB_UNSPECIFIED 0.0
00553 #define DILSUPS_BND_UNSPECIFIED 0.0
00554 #define DILSUPS_TD_UNSPECIFIED  -1
00555 #define DILSUPS_URG_UNSPECIFIED 0.0
00556 #define DILSUPS_PRI_UNSPECIFIED 0.0
00557 #define DILSUPS_TDPROP_FIXED 1
00558 #define PLAN_OUTCOME_LIKELIHOOD relevance
00559 protected:
00560   DIL_entry * entry;
00561   DIL_entry * superior; // caches information returned by Superiorbyid()
00562   time_t _targetdate; // target date (in calendar time) for completion (values < 0 should be interpreted as MAXTIME_T)
00563   int _tdproperty; // target date properties (e.g. TDPROP_FIXED)
00564 public:
00565   // constructors
00566   DIL_AL_List(DIL_entry & e); // (see utilities.cc)
00567   DIL_AL_List(DIL_entry & e, String pfile, String ptitle, float prelevance, float punbounded, float pbounded, time_t ptargetdate, int ptdprop, float purgency, float ppriority); // (see utilities.cc)
00568   // destructor (see http://www.geocrawler.com/archives/3/361/1998/1/0/2004286/)
00569   ~DIL_AL_List() {} 
00570   // parameters
00571   filetitle_t al; // AL file (absolute URL with #ID) and title (#ID)
00572   // Note: By default, if al.title is not a DIL ID, then
00573   // it is assumed to be a self-reference.
00574   // *** Parameters may change when the method based on
00575   //     the DIL dependency hierarchy is implemented
00576   //     (e.g. target dates obtained from earliest target
00577   //     dates of superior unless an earlier date is given)
00578   float relevance; // relevance to project / dependence of superior (see DIL#20001006114606.1)
00579         // if target entry is OUTCOME this parameter is the "likelihood"
00580   float unbounded; // unbounded importance
00581   float bounded; // bounded importance
00582   float urgency; // computed urgency
00583   float priority; // computed priority
00584   // *** change these functions if a linked list is provided
00585   inline DIL_entry * Superiorbyid(); // returns superior DIL entry if found, otherwise returns "*entry"
00586   inline bool IsSelfReference();
00587   time_t targetdate() { return _targetdate; }
00588   int tdproperty() { return _tdproperty; }
00589   bool set_targetdate(time_t td) { if (_tdproperty==DILSUPS_TDPROP_FIXED) return false; _targetdate = td; return true; }
00590   void set_tdproperty(int tdprop) { _tdproperty=tdprop; }
00591   bool Write_to_Binary_Cache(ofstream & cfl);
00592   bool Read_from_Binary_Cache(ifstream & cfl);
00593   bool Binary_Cache_Diagnostic(DIL_AL_List * cached, int & testedbytes);
00594 };
00595 
00596 /*
00597         <A NAME="DIL-Parameter-Entry">
00598         DIL by ID Parameter Entry File FOrmat (Mandatory Elements):
00599         </A>
00600         
00601         Entries List Begin Marker
00602                 <!-- dil2al: DIL ID begin -->
00603         Entry Data Begin Marker
00604                 <TR>
00605         Entry Data Lines
00606                 <TD><A NAME="-id-number-">-id-number-</A>\n
00607                 <TD><A HREF="-topical-DIL-reference-">-topic-title-</A> (-relevance-), <A HREF="-topical-DIL-reference-">-topic-title-</A> (-relevance-), -etc.-\n
00608                 <TD><A HREF="-AL-reference-">-AL-title-</A> (-relevance-,-unb.imp.-,-bound.imp.-,-target-date-,-urgency-,-priority-), -etc.-\n
00609         *** As the dependency hierarchy is implemented, replace the
00610             AL references with superior DIL entry references
00611 */
00612 
00613 // DIL list parameters
00614 //   1) topics (=topical DIL files & specific parameters)
00615 //   2) projects (= superiors & superior specific parameters)
00616 // Note: The topics information does not include the referenced content
00617 // in the topical DIL files.
00618 class DIL_entry_parameters {
00619 protected:
00620   DIL_entry * entry;
00621   int origloc; // original location of DIL entry when read from DIL-by-ID file
00622 public:
00623   // constructors
00624   DIL_entry_parameters(DIL_entry & e, int loc = -1): entry(&e), origloc(loc) {}
00625   // parameters
00626   PLLRoot<DIL_Topical_List> topics;
00627   PLLRoot<DIL_AL_List> projects;
00628   // functions
00629   bool topic_append(String tfile, String ttitle, float trelevance)      { return topics.link_before(new DIL_Topical_List(*entry,tfile,ttitle,trelevance)); }
00630   bool topic_prepend(String tfile, String ttitle, float trelevance) { return topics.link_after(new DIL_Topical_List(*entry,tfile,ttitle,trelevance)); }
00631   bool project_append(String pfile, String ptitle, float prelevance, float punbounded, float pbounded, time_t ptargetdate, int ptdprop, float purgency, float ppriority) {
00632     return projects.link_before(new DIL_AL_List(*entry,pfile,ptitle,prelevance,punbounded,pbounded,ptargetdate,ptdprop,purgency,ppriority));
00633   }
00634   bool project_prepend(String pfile, String ptitle, float prelevance, float punbounded, float pbounded, time_t ptargetdate, int ptdprop, float purgency, float ppriority) {
00635     return projects.link_after(new DIL_AL_List(*entry,pfile,ptitle,prelevance,punbounded,pbounded,ptargetdate,ptdprop,purgency,ppriority));
00636   }
00637   int OrigLoc() { return origloc; }
00638   bool Write_to_Binary_Cache(ofstream & cfl);
00639   bool Read_from_Binary_Cache(ifstream & cfl);
00640   bool Binary_Cache_Diagnostic(DIL_entry_parameters * cached, int & testedbytes);
00641 };
00642 
00643 // DIL identifier and link to content
00644 //  1) id
00645 //  2) content
00646 //  3) parameters (= topics & projects)
00647 class DIL_entry: public DIL_ID, public PLLHandle<DIL_entry> {
00648 protected:
00649 #ifdef LOOP_PROTECT
00650   #define TD_PROTECT    1
00651 #endif
00652   mutable int semaphore; // beware of simultaneous use for different purposes!
00653   Text_File_Buffers * tfb; // points to Detailed_Items_List or other source (is cleaned up there)
00654 public:
00655   // constructors
00656   DIL_entry(Text_File_Buffers & t); // (see utilities.cc)
00657   DIL_entry(Text_File_Buffers & t, String & idstr); // preferred constructor
00658   DIL_entry(Text_File_Buffers & t, const SubString & idstr); // preferred constructor
00659   // destructor
00660   ~DIL_entry() { delete content; delete parameters; }
00661   // parameters
00662   DIL_entry_content * content;
00663   DIL_entry_parameters * parameters;
00664   // *** Can add functions to obtain individual DIL entry
00665   //     content or parameter data
00666   // functions
00667   DIL_entry * elbyid(const DIL_ID & id) const;
00668   DIL_entry * operator[](DIL_ID & id) { return elbyid(id); }
00669   DIL_Topical_List * Topics(int n) { if (parameters) if (parameters->topics.head()) return parameters->topics.head()->el(n); return NULL; }
00670   DIL_AL_List * Projects(int n) { if (parameters) if (parameters->projects.head()) return parameters->projects.head()->el(n); return NULL; }
00671   void Set_Semaphore(int svalue) { semaphore = svalue; }
00672   int Get_Semaphore() { return semaphore; }
00673   void Set_Semaphores(int svalue) { semaphore = svalue; if (Next()) Next()->Set_Semaphores(svalue); }
00674 #ifdef LOOP_PROTECT
00675   time_t Propagated_Target_Date(bool warn, bool top = true) const;
00676   time_t Target_Date(bool top = true) const { return Propagated_Target_Date(true,top); }
00677 #else
00678   time_t Propagated_Target_Date(bool warn,) const;
00679   time_t Target_Date() const { return Propagated_Target_Date(true); }
00680 #endif
00681   time_t Local_Target_Date(int n, time_t unspecified = -2) { if (Projects(n)) return Projects(n)->targetdate(); return unspecified; }
00682   time_t Time_Required() { if (content) return content->required; return (time_t) 0; }
00683   float Completion_State() { if (content) return content->completion; return (float) 0.0; }
00684   String * Entry_Text() { if (content) return content->text; return NULL; }
00685   bool Get_Entry_Parameters(String & parstr);
00686   bool Is_Direct_Dependency_Of(const DIL_entry * superior); // (see utilities.cc)
00687   bool Is_Dependency_Of(DIL_entry * superior); // (see utilities.cc)
00688   bool Has_Superiors(bool taggedonly = false); // (see utilities.cc)
00689   int Is_Plan_Entry(); // (see utilities.cc)
00690   bool Write_to_Binary_Cache(ofstream & cfl); // (see utilities.cc)
00691   bool Write_Topical_to_Binary_Cache(ofstream & cfl, bool gottext); // (see utilities.cc)
00692   bool Read_from_Binary_Cache(ifstream & cfl); // (see utilities.cc)
00693   bool Read_Topical_from_Binary_Cache(ifstream & cfl, bool gottext); // (see utilities.cc)
00694   bool Binary_Cache_Diagnostic(DIL_entry * cached, int & testedbytes); // (see utilities.cc)
00695 };

00725 // Data to be used at a specific level of DIL hierarchy generation
00726 class DIL_Hierarchy_Level_Data: public PLLHandle<DIL_Hierarchy_Level_Data> {
00727 protected:
00728   DIL_entry * entry;
00729 public:
00730   DIL_Hierarchy_Level_Data(DIL_entry & e,double l = DILSUPS_REL_UNSPECIFIED): entry(&e), likelihood(l), benefit(0.0), risk(0.0) {}
00731   double likelihood;
00732   double benefit;
00733   double risk;
00734   DIL_entry * Entry() { return entry; }
00735   virtual void reset_benefit_risk() { benefit=0.0; risk=0.0; }
00736   virtual bool has_benefit_risk() { return ((benefit!=0.0) || (risk!=0.0)); }
00737 };

00804 class AL_TC: public PLLHandle<AL_TC> {
00805 // AL Task Chunk
00806         protected:
00807                 DIL_entry * de; // allocated DIL entry
00808                 float val; // value set by random distribution function
00809         public:
00810                 // constructors
00811                 AL_TC(): de(NULL), val(0.0) {}
00812                 AL_TC(long itc, long i_limit);
00813                 // destructor (see http://www.geocrawler.com/archives/3/361/1998/1/0/2004286/)
00814                 ~AL_TC() {} 
00815                 // functions
00816                 AL_TC * next_avail_el(); // (see alcomp.cc)
00817                 AL_TC * avail_el(unsigned int n); // (see alcomp.cc)
00818                 void set_val(float v) { val = v; }
00819                 DIL_entry * Get_DE() { return de; }
00820                 operator DIL_entry *() { return Get_DE(); }
00821                 long available_before(unsigned int n); // (see alcomp.cc)
00822                 float allocate_with_value(float uval, DIL_entry * d); // (see alcomp.cc)
00823                 // *** Is the Set_DE() function dangerous? The only additional
00824                 //     power over allocate() is the ability to allocate to TCs
00825                 //     that already have de!=NULL. Could this happen accidentally?
00826                 DIL_entry * Set_DE(DIL_entry * d) { DIL_entry * dprev = de; de = d; return dprev; }
00827                 AL_TC * allocate(DIL_entry * d); // (see alcomp.cc)
00828 };

00845 class AL_Day: public PLLHandle<AL_Day> {
00846 // AL Day
00847         protected:
00848                 // parameters
00849                 int daytype; // 0 = full day, 1 = start, 2 = end
00850                 long avail; // task chunks available (not yet allocated)
00851                 long tot; // total number of task chunks (allocated+available)
00852                 time_t daydate; // date of day (at 00:00 in local time)
00853                 time_t daystart; // work start offset (in seconds, GM time interval)
00854                 time_t daystartmin; // lower limit (e.g. current time, GM time interval)
00855                 time_t daymaxt; // upper limit (e.g. generatealmaxt, GM time interval)
00856                 time_t tcseconds; // task chunk size in seconds, cached value for computations
00857                 bool expanded; // flag set if day is expanded
00858                 long cache_i_start;
00859                 long cache_i_limit;
00860         public:
00861                 // constructor
00862                 AL_Day(time_t dd, int typ, time_t tcsec, time_t dsmin, time_t dmaxt = SECONDSPERDAY);
00863                 // destructor (see http://www.geocrawler.com/archives/3/361/1998/1/0/2004286/)
00864                 ~AL_Day() {} 
00865                 // parameters
00866                 PLLRoot<AL_TC> tc; // list of task chunks
00867                 PLLRoot<AL_TD> td; // list of target date DIL entries
00868                 // *** perhaps protect val by offering a Reset() function that Active_List can use
00869                 float val; // value set by random distribution function
00870                 // functions
00871                 int DayType() { return daytype; }
00872                 time_t DayDate() { return daydate; }
00873                 time_t DayStart() { return daystart; }
00874                 time_t DayStartMin() { return daystartmin; }
00875                 time_t DayMaxt() { return daymaxt; }
00876                 bool Expanded() { return expanded; }
00877                 long Avail() { return avail; }
00878                 long Total() { return tot; }
00879                 AL_TC * TC_Head() { return tc.head(); }
00880                 AL_TC * TC_Tail() { return tc.tail(); }
00881                 AL_TD * TD_Head() { return td.head(); }
00882                 AL_TD * TD_Tail() { return td.tail(); }
00883                 long set_avail(time_t av); // (see alcomp.cc)
00884                 long available_before(time_t td); // (see alcomp.cc)
00885                 int days_to(time_t td); // (see alcomp.cc)
00886                 void create_TCs(bool setvalues = false); // (see alcomp.cc)
00887                 enum TC_add_method { TAIL_REPLACE, RANDOM, BEFORE_HEAD };
00888                 void add_TCs(long tcs, TC_add_method m, time_t addborder = MAXTIME_T); // (see alcomp.cc)
00889                 long expand(long expandn, time_t td); // (see alcomp.cc)
00890                 float set_TC_values(long & i_start, long i_limit); // (see alcomp.cc)
00891                 float allocate_with_value(float uval, DIL_entry * de); // (see alcomp.cc)
00892                 AL_TC * Get_Avail_TC(unsigned long n); // (see alcomp.cc)
00893                 AL_TC * allocate(DIL_entry * de); // (see alcomp.cc)
00894                 AL_Day * Add_Target_Date(DIL_entry * de); // (see alcomp.cc)
00895                 long remove_unused_TCs(); // (see alcomp.cc)
00896                 float linear_day_distribution(time_t td); // (see alcomp.cc)
00897                 float squared_day_distribution(time_t td); // (see alcomp.cc)
00898 };

00900 class Active_List {
00901 // Active List
00902         protected:
00903                 // parameters
00904                 DIL_entry * superior; // superior DIL entry of AL (NULL=AL with all DIL entries)
00905                 String supstr; // string identifying superior, default "all"
00906                 String alfilestr; // file base string, default "active-list.all"
00907                 long allength; // number of TCs in AL
00908                 // functions
00909                 long Initialize_AL_Length(long req[], long deplen, time_t algenwt, DIL_entry * superior = NULL); // (see alcomp.cc)
00910         public:
00911                 // constructor
00912                 Active_List(long req[], long deplen, int algenwt, DIL_entry * sup = NULL); // (see alcomp.cc)
00913                 // parameters
00914                 PLLRoot<AL_Day> al; // list of AL days
00915                 PLLRoot<AL_TD> td; // list of passed target date DIL entries
00916                 long deavail; // temporary variable for tracking of DIL entry available TCs
00917                 // note: deavail is set by available_before(), expand(),
00918                 //       allocate_with_value()
00919                 // functions
00920                 String get_supstr() { return supstr; }
00921                 String filestr() { return alfilestr; }
00922                 long length() { return allength; }
00923                 AL_Day * Add_Day(int typ, time_t tcsec, time_t dsmin, time_t dmaxt = SECONDSPERDAY); // (see alcomp.cc)
00924                 long available_before(time_t td) { if (al.head()) deavail=al.head()->available_before(td); else deavail=0; return deavail; }
00925                 long expand(long expandn, time_t td); // (see alcomp.cc)
00926                 AL_Day * AL_Head() { return al.head(); }
00927                 AL_Day * AL_Tail() { return al.tail(); }
00928                 float set_TC_values(); // (see alcomp.cc)
00929                 float allocate_with_value(float uval, DIL_entry * de); // (see alcomp.cc)
00930                 AL_TC * Get_Avail_TC(unsigned long n); // (see alcomp.cc)
00931                 AL_TC * allocate(DIL_entry * de); // (see alcomp.cc)
00932                 AL_Day * Add_Target_Date(DIL_entry * de); // (see alcomp.cc)
00933                 AL_TD * Add_Passed_Target_Date(DIL_entry * de); // (see alcomp.cc)
00934                 long remove_unused_TCs(); // (see alcomp.cc)
00935                 bool generate_focused_AL(DIL_entry * superior, time_t algenwt); // (see alcomp.cc)
00936                 bool generate_wide_AL(DIL_entry * superior); // (see alcomp.cc)
00937 };
00938 
00939 // Objects for Searching
00940 // ---------------------
00941 // See <A HREF="search-objects.fig">search-objects.fig</A>.
00942 
00943 /*
00944         The function that uses the following classes to do searches may search
00945         by following links starting from a specific file, directory or search
00946         engine search term, or may search a set of archive locations.
00947         Locations that point to directories or that are search engine search
00948         terms must be turned into a list of specific targets to search. Note
00949         that targets obtained in followlinks mode by Search_Target objects may
00950         also point to such locations. In the case of breadth-first search the
00951         conversion to specific targets may be done by the same function that
00952         controls the searching process. Otherwise, the conversion must take
00953         place in Search_Target, while adding targets to the list.
00954         Directories, search engine results and tar/zip archives can be handled
00955         in the same fashion.
00956 
00957         See <A HREF="search.cc">search.cc</A>.
00958 */
00959 
00960 //#define TARGET_ACCESS_DEBUG
00961 class Target_Access {
00962 // Target access object, can handle local and remote targets of various formats
00963 // Recognized original target references are of the following forms:
00964 // (a) local file: /some/path/to/file.ext
00965 // (b) remote HTTP: http://some.server/some/path/to/file.ext
00966 // (c) remote FTP: ftp://some_user@some.server/some/path/to/file.ext
00967 // When accessed, the target is automatically copied to a local file if necessary
00968 // and uncompressed (.gz, .Z).
00969 // *** May turn this into several classes eventually.
00970 // *** If localcopy, uncompressed and cleartext are turned into special objects, their
00971 //     destructors can take care of optional removal instead of the remove_* functions.
00972 // *** This should be documented for more wide-spread use.
00973         public:
00974                 enum Target_Access_types { TA_LOCAL, TA_LOCAL_DIRECTORY, TA_HTTP, TA_FTP, TA_UNKNOWN };
00975         protected:
00976                 String target;  // original target reference
00977                 String user, server, path;
00978                 Target_Access_types type;
00979                 String localcopy, uncompressed, cleartext; // transformed versions
00980                 bool retaintransformed;
00981                 void set_target(const char * t, const Target_Access * parent = NULL);
00982                 void remove_name_reference(String & tpath);
00983                 void remove_back_references(String & tpath);
00984                 void transformed_name(String & transformed, String & prevname);
00985                 void transformed_name(String & transformed, String & prevname, const BigRegex & transrx);
00986                 bool make_local_copy_of_directory();
00987                 bool make_local_copy_of_HTTP();
00988                 bool make_local_copy_of_FTP();
00989                 bool syscommand(String program, String args, int success = 0) const;
00990         public:
00991                 // constructor
00992                 Target_Access(const char * t): localcopy(""), uncompressed(""), cleartext(""), retaintransformed(false) { set_target(t); }
00993                 Target_Access(const Target_Access & t): target(t.target), user(t.user), server(t.server), path(t.path), type(t.type), localcopy(t.localcopy), uncompressed(t.uncompressed), cleartext(t.cleartext), retaintransformed(t.retaintransformed) {}
00994                 Target_Access(const Target_Access & parent, const char * t): localcopy(""), uncompressed(""), cleartext(""), retaintransformed(false) { set_target(t,&parent); } // relative to parent target
00995                 int isequal(const Target_Access & ta) const { return (target==ta.target); }
00996                 int operator==(const Target_Access & ta) const { return isequal(ta); }
00997                 int operator!=(const Target_Access & ta) const { return (!isequal(ta)); }
00998                 bool make_local_copy();
00999                 bool uncompress();
01000                 bool cleartext_conversion();
01001                 bool read_raw_into_String(String & text, bool warnopen = true);
01002                 bool read_uncompressed_into_String(String & text, bool warnopen = true);
01003                 bool read_cleartext_into_String(String & text, bool warnopen = true);
01004                 void remove_local_copy() { if (!localcopy.empty()) { if (type!=TA_LOCAL) remove(localcopy); localcopy = ""; } }
01005                 void remove_uncompressed() { if (!uncompressed.empty()) { if (uncompressed!=path) remove(uncompressed); uncompressed = ""; } }
01006                 void remove_cleartext() { if (!cleartext.empty()) { if (cleartext!=path) remove(cleartext); cleartext = ""; } }
01007                 String Target() const { return target; }
01008                 Target_Access_types Type() const { return type; }
01009                 void Retain_Transformed() { retaintransformed = true; } // mode selector: whether to keep transformed versions or not
01010                 void Discard_Transformed() { retaintransformed = false; }
01011 #ifdef TARGET_ACCESS_DEBUG
01012                 void Report() const;
01013 #endif
01014 };
01015 
01016 class Search_Result;
01017 
01018 class Search_Target: public PLLHandle<Search_Target> {
01019 // Target to Search
01020         // pllroot references list of targets
01021         protected:
01022                 PLLRoot<Search_Result> * results;       // reference to global list of results
01023                 String searchkey;                               // Search key to search for
01024                 Target_Access target;                   // Target in which to search
01025                 int followlinks;                                // Search links to this depth from the current target
01026                 bool localtargets;                              // True if depth-first search following links
01027                 Quick_String_Hash * encountered;        // Optional tree of previously encountered targets
01028                 // Having encountered a target before does not remove the target from any lists
01029                 // or disable actions. This is good, since statistics or other activities may wish
01030                 // to be done on repeated occurrences of a target. Having encountered a target before
01031                 // merely sets the default to searched = true, so that the efficient default is not to
01032                 // search it again. That parameter can be explicitly reset.
01033                 int searched; // 0 = remains to be searched, 1 = already searched, -1 = do not search
01034                 void check_encountered();
01035         public:
01036                 // constructor
01037                 Search_Target(PLLRoot<Search_Result> * r, const char * s, const char * t, int f, bool l, Quick_String_Hash * e = NULL): results(r), searchkey(s), target(t), followlinks(f), localtargets(l), encountered(e), searched(0) { check_encountered(); }
01038                 Search_Target(const Search_Target & parent, const char * t): results(parent.results), searchkey(parent.searchkey), target(parent.target,t), followlinks(parent.followlinks-1), localtargets(parent.localtargets), encountered(parent.encountered), searched(0) { check_encountered(); } // relative to a parent target
01039                 // *** Take care not to delete results or breadth-first targets when this object is removed!
01040                 // functions
01041                 String Target() const { return target.Target(); }
01042                 long search();
01043                 long links(const String & t);
01044                 void set_searched(int sval = 1) { searched = sval; }
01045                 void reset_searched() { searched = 0; }
01046 };
01047 
01048 class Search_Result: public PLLHandle<Search_Result> {
01049 // Result of Search
01050         // pllroot references list of results
01051         public:
01052                 enum Search_Result_types { SR_REGULAR, SR_DIRECTORY_ENTRY, SR_URL };
01053         protected:
01054                 // searchkey and target are copied here so that Search_Target can be deleted and results retained
01055                 String searchkey;               // Search key for which this result was found
01056                 Target_Access target;   // Target in which this result was found
01057                 String pretext, keytext, posttext;      // Key found and surrounding text
01058                 long location;                  // Result location in target
01059                 Search_Result_types type;
01060         public:
01061                 // constructor
01062                 Search_Result(const char * s, const Target_Access & t, String & text, const BigRegex & skrx);
01063                 // functions
01064                 Search_Result_types Type() { return type; }
01065                 int isequal(const Search_Result & sr) const;
01066                 int operator==(const Search_Result & sr) const { return isequal(sr); }
01067                 int operator!=(const Search_Result & sr) const { return (!isequal(sr)); }
01068                 String HTML_put_text() const;
01069                 operator const char *() const { return (const char *) HTML_put_text(); }
01070 };

01072 class Financial_Note: public PLLHandle<Financial_Note> {
01073   // Financial note item
01074   // pllroot references list of financial notes
01075 protected:
01076   time_t date;
01077   double expense;
01078   String type; // e.g. variable, regular, planned, car, baby, utilities, etc.
01079   bool handled; // true if this item has already been included in the financial accounting
01080   String note;
01081   String comment;
01082 public:
01083   Financial_Note(time_t d, double e, String t, bool h, String n, String c): date(d), expense(e), type(t), handled(h), note(n), comment(c) {}
01084   Financial_Note(): date(0), expense(0.0), type(""), handled(false), note(""), comment("") {}
01085   Financial_Note(String & s, time_t & t, int & sloc) { sloc = get(s,t,sloc); }
01086   int get(String & s, time_t & t, int sloc = 0);
01087   String put() const;
01088   void link_sorted(PLLRoot<Financial_Note> & r);
01089   time_t Date() const { return date; }
01090   bool Handled() const { return handled; }
01091   String Type() const { return type; }
01092   double Expense() const { return expense; }
01093 };

01152 
01153 inline DIL_entry * DIL_AL_List::Superiorbyid() {
01154 // assumes entry is in Detailed_Items_List
01155 // returns pointer to superior if found, pointer to self (*entry) if
01156 // no valid DIL ID was given, or NULL if the valid DIL ID could not
01157 // be found in the Detailed_Items_List
01158         if (!superior) { // fill the cache
01159                 DIL_ID did(al.title);
01160                 if (did.valid()) superior = entry->head()->elbyid(did);
01161                 else superior = entry;
01162         }
01163         return superior;
01164 }
01165 
01166 inline DIL_entry * Plan_entry_content::Decision_Ptr() {
01167   if (!decisionptr) decisionptr=entry->elbyid(decisionID);
01168   return decisionptr;
01169 }
01170 
01171 inline bool DIL_AL_List::IsSelfReference() {
01172         DIL_ID did(al.title);
01173         return ((entry->str()==al.title) || (!did.valid()));
01174 }
